adrFormatAddress: 223 1st Ave., New York, NY 10003, USA

editorialSummary.text: Informal Chinese joint offering a wide range of classic soups & noodle bowls & other popular dishes.

originalText.text: Sometimes you just want hassle free, NYC style, inexpensive Chinese food in a no no no frills setting. Mee is that kind of spot. It moved out of my neighborhood when Covid shut it down, and I missed the roast soy chicken noodle soup that got me through the winter. I am happy as a clam that I can make a quick trek down to the East Village for a hot steamy bowl. The waiter is the best, he remembered me and what I liked. I've had other dishes as well but I mostly recommend the roast meet noodle soups. The duck soup is very good. Like I said, quick cheap eats, satisfying and good noodle soups!

originalText.text: Iâ€™ve been coming here for years, usually for lunch when working in the area. Nice selection of lunch specials, great food and excellent service. They hit the mark with the Cantonese style noodle soups, my favorites are the Noodle with Roast Duck Soup and the Noodle & Cantonese Wonton. But my favorite is in their Vegetable section and is NOT vegetarian (neither am I, obviously). I know many of you meat eaters out there donâ€™t even look at the Vegetable section of a Chinese restaurant menu, so donâ€™t miss ordering the Dry SautÃ©ed String Bean with Meat. The string beans are dry wokâ€™d with salty and spicy ground pork. And itâ€™s the perfect amount of spiciness, wow! Really, everything is delicious, you canâ€™t go wrong. Highest recommendation.

originalText.text:
Iâ€™m a true regular to this place! 80% of the time, Iâ€™m exhausted from work and pick up food from mee noodles. 20% of the time, I dine in. It never disappoints!! An authentic local joint (that also have Americanized food if you are into it).

But you know a place is authentic when they have white pepper on the table. You canâ€™t have southern Chinese food without some good white pepper!

My go to dish is always soup noodle with roasted duck and I get it with the wide rice noodles. So yummy! And it has vegetables in it for some health value.

I speak Chinese with the workers here and they are all so lovely. I love my people ðŸ¥°. Yummy food and kind souls.

And did I mentionâ€¦ very affordable prices? I hope that gentrification will never hit this place.

originalText.text: great chinese food, glad it's in the neighborhood

originalText.text: This Place is awesome!  It a nice small quaint family place. I love the service, food is always good!  The waitress is hard at work making sure customers are kept comfortable, and not needing anything for long. Chuan  is very attentive, and polite. Came down from the Bronx just to eat here again and take my FiancÃ© out to get the same great tastes I did.  The Hot and Sour soup was banging! I love my baby shrimp and broccoli with egg fried rice!!  The chicken and shrimp  was great!  GET THE HOUSE MADE MUSTARD!!!
